{'http://jsomers.net/blog/book-clubs': ('\n'
                                        '\n'
                                        'Most book clubs are doing it wrong\n'
                                        '\n'
                                        '\n'
                                        'by\n'
                                        '\n'
                                        'James Somers\n'
                                        '\n'
                                        ', July 15, 2017\n'
                                        '\n'
                                        '\n'
                                        '\n'
                                        'The standard way to run a book club '
                                        'is to have everybody finish the book '
                                        'before meeting to talk about it. You '
                                        'have one meeting per book. The '
                                        'discussion goes on for one or two '
                                        'hours before it runs out of gas, and '
                                        'then the group picks the next book, '
                                        'and you agree to meet in another '
                                        'month or six weeks.\n'
                                        '\n'
                                        '\n'
                                        'You would never run a class this way, '
                                        'because it practically minimizes the '
                                        'value that each participant gets from '
                                        'being in the group. The problem is '
                                        'that there’s no time to cash in on '
                                        'anyone else’s insights. If someone '
                                        'says something in the meeting that '
                                        'reframes how you think about the book '
                                        '— they suggest that Holden is lying, '
                                        'or that Kinbote wrote Canto IV; they '
                                        'tell you to read\n'
                                        '\n'
                                        'Portrait\n'
                                        '\n'
                                        'first, so you can understand '
                                        'Stephen’s double bind; they claim '
                                        'that Offred’s tale is a series of '
                                        'transcripts, not journal entries — '
                                        'well, now it’s too late, because '
                                        'you’ve finished reading the book and '
                                        'you’re probably never going back to '
                                        'it.\n'
                                        '\n'
                                        '\n'
                                        'What makes a class useful is '
                                        'precisely that it lets you compare '
                                        'notes with your classmates\n'
                                        '\n'
                                        'along the way\n'
                                        '\n'
                                        ', to float your working theories '
                                        'about a book and see how they sound '
                                        'to others. It’s not a retrospective, '
                                        'or not merely one — you’re\n'
                                        '\n'
                                        'equipping\n'
                                        '\n'
                                        'yourself for the rest of the '
                                        'reading.\n'
                                        '\n'
                                        '\n'
                                        'This is true not just of frameworks '
                                        'or theories or whatever but of little '
                                        'nuts-and-bolts stuff, too, like when '
                                        'someone points out a reference that '
                                        'you missed or helps you savor some '
                                        'language that you blew right by the '
                                        'first time. That kind of thing is '
                                        'especially valuable when you’re '
                                        'reading a difficult book.\n'
                                        '\n'
                                        '\n'
                                        'My book club started four years ago '
                                        'to read\n'
                                        '\n'
                                        'Infinite Jest\n'
                                        '\n'
                                        '. There were five or six of us; we '
                                        'had all tried, and failed, to read '
                                        'the book on our own. We met every '
                                        'week and read about fifty pages for '
                                        'each meeting — five or six hours’ '
                                        'worth for a book that dense. If you '
                                        'were out of town, you tried to call '
                                        'or Skype in, and you were forgiven '
                                        'for missing a few sessions, so long '
                                        'as you more or less kept up with the '
                                        'reading.\n'
                                        '\n'
                                        '\n'
                                        'Since then we’ve run just about '
                                        'continuously, every week, week in, '
                                        'week out, for four years. We’ve read '
                                        'other hard books, and easy ones too, '
                                        'and no matter what, we’ve always '
                                        'split the reading into at least more '
                                        'than one meeting, because isn’t that '
                                        'after all how you make use of those '
                                        'other minds? Book club, for us, isn’t '
                                        'about reading the same book; it’s '
                                        'about reading a book\n'
                                        '\n'
                                        'together\n'
                                        '\n'
                                        '.\n'
                                        '\n'
                                        '\n'
                                        'We try to keep the reading to about '
                                        'the amount you can do in a few hours '
                                        'on a Sunday afternoon. Weekly book '
                                        'club has become a fixture in our '
                                        'schedules, an institution like family '
                                        'dinner, though it’s not uncommon for '
                                        'someone to skip a whole book, say if '
                                        'they’re traveling a lot or right '
                                        'after they’ve started a new job. The '
                                        'idea is to make book club less an '
                                        'obligation than a sort of pleasant '
                                        'presence in our lives, this thing '
                                        'that’s always there.\n'
                                        '\n'
                                        '\n'
                                        'Some books don’t really demand so '
                                        'much attention, and our book-talk '
                                        'during those sessions quickly '
                                        'devolves into banter. But most of the '
                                        'time the discussion lasts a full hour '
                                        'before it runs out of steam, '
                                        'naturally, the way almost all '
                                        'meetings seem to.\n'
                                        '\n'
                                        '\n'
                                        'That’s another reason to break a book '
                                        'into pieces: better to have too '
                                        'little to fit into a session than too '
                                        'much; god forbid you read something '
                                        'complex and demanding — do you really '
                                        'want to spend three hours in the '
                                        'unpacking, or to have the session '
                                        'break down before the unpacking’s '
                                        'done? And what are the odds that '
                                        'you’ll even remember most of the book '
                                        'by the time six weeks pass?\n'
                                        '\n'
                                        '\n'
                                        'Good books are almost fractally deep: '
                                        'you find whole worlds wherever you '
                                        'look, and no matter how far in you '
                                        'zoom. Breaking a book into multiple '
                                        'meetings makes the most of this fact. '
                                        'It gives you space to\n'
                                        '\n'
                                        'dwell\n'
                                        '\n'
                                        '— on a page, even on a single word — '
                                        'without feeling like you’re wasting '
                                        'anyone’s time. No: that’s what a book '
                                        'club is\n'
                                        '\n'
                                        'for\n'
                                        '\n'
                                        ', not to sum up what you’ve read but '
                                        'to live inside it.\n'
                                        '\n'
                                        '\n'
                                        'I don’t know why more people don’t '
                                        'run book clubs this way. I think part '
                                        'of it is that they’ve never tried; '
                                        'the very concept of a book club seems '
                                        'to imply a one-book-per-meeting '
                                        'structure. Others hear the idea of '
                                        'meeting weekly and think who has the '
                                        'time?\n'
                                        '\n'
                                        '\n'
                                        'I would say that anyone who loves '
                                        'books has the time. A book club run '
                                        'in the standard way isn’t efficient '
                                        'or practical — it’s just a good '
                                        'opportunity wasted.',
                                        'Estimate reading time: 4 minutes'),

                                                                                       'Analysis '

                                                                                       '\n'
                                                                                       '\n'
                                                                                       'We '

                                                                                       'is '
                                                                                       'made '

                                                                                       'oil, '
                                                                                       'animal '

                                                                                       'tree '

                                                                                       'bitumen '
                                                                                       '– '
                                                                                       'which '
                                                                                       'is '
                                                                                       'solid '
                                                                                       'crude '
                                                                                       'oil. '
                                                                                       'The '
                                                                                       'exact '
                                                                                       'ingredients '
                                                                                       'vary '
                                                                                       'from '
                                                                                       'one '
                                                                                       'coffin '
                                                                                       'to '
                                                                                       'the '
                                                                                       'next, '
                                                                                       'but '
                                                                                       'the '
                                                                                       'goo '
                                                                                       'was '
                                                                                       'always '
                                                                                       'made '
                                                                                       'from '
                                                                                       'some '
                                                                                       'of '
                                                                                       'these '
                                                                                       'ingredients. '
                                                                                       'It '
                                                                                       'is '
                                                                                       'possible '
                                                                                       'there '
                                                                                       'were '
                                                                                       'other '
                                                                                       'ingredients '
                                                                                       'as '
                                                                                       'well, '
                                                                                       'that '
                                                                                       'we '
                                                                                       'can '
                                                                                       'no '
                                                                                       'longer '
                                                                                       'detect, '
                                                                                       'because '
                                                                                       'they '
                                                                                       'were '
                                                                                       'volatile '
                                                                                       'and '

                                                                                       'including '
                                                                                       'the '
                                                                                       'seated '
                                                                                       'figure '
                                                                                       'pictured '
                                                                                       'below. '
                                                                                       'Many '
                                                                                       'statues '
                                                                                       'from '
                                                                                       'the '
                                                                                       'tomb '
                                                                                       'of '
                                                                                       'Tutankhamun '
                                                                                       'were '
                                                                                       'also '
                                                                                       'covered '
                                                                                       'in '
                                                                                       'black '
                                                                                       'goo, '
                                                                                       'although '
                                                                                       'these '
                                                                                       'examples '
                                                                                       'have '
                                                                                       'not '
                                                                                       'been '
                                                                                       'analysed. '
                                                                                       'Some '
                                                                                       'shabti '
                                                                                       'boxes '
                                                                                       '(boxes '
                                                                                       'used '
                                                                                       'for '
                                                                                       'holding '

                                                                                       'left '
                                                                                       'in '

                                                                                       'tomb '

                                                                                       'were '
                                                                                       'also '
                                                                                       'coated '
                                                                                       'in '
                                                                                       'black '
                                                                                       'goo. '
                                                                                       'So, '
                                                                                       'it '

                                                                                       'that '
                                                                                       'the '
                                                                                       'goo '

                                                                                       'important '

                                                                                       'fluid '

                                                                                       '\n'
                                                                                       'Wooden '
                                                                                       'figure '
                                                                                       'of '

                                                                                       'that '

                                                                                       'out '

                                                '\n'

                                                '\n'
                                                'Pelorus Jack in 1909\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                'Species\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                "Risso's dolphin\n"
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                'Years active\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '1888–1912\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                'Known\xa0for\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                'Escorting ships near\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                'French Pass\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                'Appearance\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                'White colour with grey lines '
                                                'or shadings; round, white '
                                                'head\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                'Named after\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                'Pelorus Sound\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                ', in the\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                'Marlborough Sounds\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                ',\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                'New Zealand\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                'Cook Strait\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                'Location of Cook Strait\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                'Pelorus Jack\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '(\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                'fl.\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '1888\xa0– April 1912) was a\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                "Risso's dolphin\n"
                                                '\n'
                                                'that was famous for meeting '
                                                'and escorting ships through a '
                                                'stretch of water in\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                'Cook Strait\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                ',\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                'New Zealand\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                ', between 1888 and 1912. '
                                                'Pelorus Jack was usually '
                                                'spotted in\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                'Admiralty Bay\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                'between Cape Francis and '
                                                'Collinet Point, near\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                'French Pass\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                ', a notoriously dangerous '
                                                'channel used by ships '
                                                'travelling between\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                'Wellington\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                'and\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                'Nelson\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '.\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                'Pelorus Jack was shot at from '
                                                'a passing ship, and was later '
                                                'protected by a 1904 New '
                                                'Zealand law.\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                'Contents\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                'Appearance\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '[\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                'edit\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                ']\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                'Pelorus Jack was '
                                                'approximately 13 feet (4\xa0'
                                                'm) long and was of a white '
                                                'color with grey lines or '
                                                'shadings, and a round, white '
                                                'head.\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '[1]\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                'Although its sex was never '
                                                'determined, it was identified '
                                                'from photographs as a\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                "Risso's dolphin\n"
                                                '\n'
                                                ',\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                'Grampus griseus\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '. This is an uncommon species '
                                                'in New Zealand waters, and '
                                                "only 12 Risso's dolphins have "
                                                'been reported in that area.\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '[2]\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                'Pelorus Jack. Photographed by '
                                                'A. Pitt.\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                'History\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '[\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                'edit\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                ']\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                'Pelorus Jack guided the ships '
                                                'by swimming alongside a water '
                                                'craft for 20 minutes at a '
                                                'time. If the crew could not '
                                                'see Jack at first, they often '
                                                'waited for him to appear.\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                'Despite his name, he did not '
                                                'live in nearby\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                'Pelorus Sound\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '; instead, he would often '
                                                'guide ships through dangerous '
                                                'passages of French Pass. '
                                                'However, some local residents '
                                                'familiar with his habits '
                                                'claim that he never went '
                                                'through French Pass itself.\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '[3]\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                'Pelorus Jack was first seen '
                                                'around 1888 when it appeared '
                                                'in front of the\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                'schooner\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                'Brindle\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                'when the ship approached '
                                                'French Pass, a channel '
                                                'located between\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                "D'Urville Island\n"
                                                '\n'
                                                'and the\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                'South Island\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '. When the members of the '
                                                'crew saw the dolphin bobbing '
                                                'up and down in front of the '
                                                'ship, they wanted to kill '
                                                'him, but the captain’s wife '
                                                'talked them out of it. To '
                                                'their amazement, the dolphin '
                                                'then proceeded to guide the '
                                                'ship through the narrow '
                                                'channel. And for years '
                                                'thereafter, he safely guided '
                                                'almost every ship that came '
                                                'by. With rocks and strong '
                                                'currents, the area is '
                                                'dangerous to ships, but no '
                                                'shipwrecks occurred when Jack '
                                                'was present.\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '[4]\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                'Many sailors and travellers '
                                                'saw Pelorus Jack, and he was '
                                                'mentioned in local newspapers '
                                                'and depicted in postcards.\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                'Jack was last seen in April '
                                                '1912. There were various '
                                                'rumours connected to his '
                                                'disappearance, including '
                                                'fears that foreign whalers '
                                                'might have harpooned him. '
                                                'However, research suggests '
                                                'that Pelorus Jack was an old '
                                                'animal; his head was white '
                                                'and his body pale, both '
                                                'indications of age, so it is '
                                                'likely that he died of '
                                                'natural causes.\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '[2]\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                'Since 1989, Pelorus Jack has '
                                                'been used as a symbol for '
                                                'the\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                'Interislander\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                ', a ferry service across the '
                                                'Cook Strait, and is '
                                                'incorporated into the livery '
                                                'of the ships in the fleet.\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '[5]\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                'Shooting incident\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '[\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                'edit\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                ']\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                'In 1904, someone aboard the\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                'SS Penguin\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                'tried to shoot Pelorus Jack '
                                                'with a rifle. Despite the '
                                                'attempt on his life, Pelorus '
                                                'Jack continued to help ships. '
                                                'According to folklore, '
                                                'however, he no longer helped '
                                                'the\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                'Penguin\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                ', which shipwrecked in Cook '
                                                'Strait in 1909.\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '[6]\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '[7]\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                'Protection\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '[\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                'edit\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                ']\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                'Following the shooting '
                                                'incident, a law was proposed '
                                                'to protect Pelorus Jack. He '
                                                'became protected by\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                'Order in Council\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                'under the Sea Fisheries Act '
                                                'on 26 September 1904. Pelorus '
                                                'Jack remained protected by '
                                                'that law until his '
                                                'disappearance in 1912. It is '
                                                'believed that he was the '
                                                'first individual sea creature '
                                                'protected by law in any '
                                                'country.\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '[3]\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                'Cultural references\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '[\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                'edit\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                ']\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '"Pelorus Jack" is a Scottish '
                                                'Country dance,\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '[8]\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                'named in honour of the '
                                                'dolphin. This dance features '
                                                'a set of alternating tandem '
                                                'half-reels (or heys) where '
                                                'two people act as one but '
                                                'swap who leads at the reel '
                                                'ends, this is now known as a\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                'Dolphin Reel\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '.\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '[9]\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                'Arthur Ransome\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                'mentions Pelorus Jack as '
                                                'accompanying ships and '
                                                'receiving protection in his '
                                                '1932 novel\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                'Peter Duck\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '. However, the character of '
                                                'Peter Duck incorrectly '
                                                'locates the dolphin as living '
                                                'in\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                'Sydney Harbour\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '.\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '[10]\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                'Singer/Songwriter\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                'Andrea Prodan\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                'tells the tale of the dolphin '
                                                "in the song 'Pelorus Jack' in "
                                                'his 1996 all-vocal record\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                'Viva Voce\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '.\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                'See also\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '[\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                'edit\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                ']\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                'References\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '[\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                'edit\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                '\n'
                                                ']\n'

                                                                  'The fashion '

                                                                  'also one of '
                                                                  'the hardest '

                                                                  'countries '
                                                                  'by the '
                                                                  'pandemic.\n'
                                                                  '\n'
                                                                  '\n'
                                                                  '\n'
                                                                  '\n'
                                                                  '\n'
                                                                  'With '
                                                                  'tourism '
                                                                  'down, and '
                                                                  'social '
                                                                  'distancing '
                                                                  'norms in '
                                                                  'place, the '
                                                                  'big brands '
                                                                  'are facing '
                                                                  'a lot of '
                                                                  'trouble. '
                                                                  'Brands have '
                                                                  'seen more '
                                                                  'than 80% '
                                                                  'decline in '
                                                                  'orders '
                                                                  'since the '
                                                                  'pandemic '
                                                                  'began, '
                                                                  'making this '
                                                                  'one of the '
                                                                  'toughest '
                                                                  'times '
                                                                  'financially '
                                                                  'for the '
                                                                  'industry '
                                                                  'since its '
                                                                  'origins\n'
                                                                  '\n'
                                                                  'nearly 9 '
                                                                  'centuries '
                                                                  'ago\n'
                                                                  '\n'
                                                                  '. 🙁\n'
                                                                  '\n'
                                                                  '\n'
                                                                  'When large '
                                                                  'brands '
                                                                  'suffer, its '
                                                                  'always the '
                                                                  'small '
                                                                  'suppliers '
                                                                  'who take '
                                                                  'the hardest '
                                                                  'hit. '
                                                                  'Suppliers '
                                                                  'who provide '
                                                                  'everything '
                                                                  'from soles '
                                                                  'to fabrics '
                                                                  'are going '
                                                                  'under as '
                                                                  'they '
